intro: Peristrophe parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered peristrophe, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with showy, violet-blue petals that attract pollinators. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is native to regions in Africa and southern Asia. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
